vehicleUsageLabelHelp:
Commute to work or school: Regular commute to and from your place of employment or education.

Business: For business purposes during the day in occupations that involve making regular sales or business calls.

Pleasure: Not used on a regular basis for business, or for work or school commuting purposes.

Transportation Network: Used in connection with any "transportation network" company using an internet-enabled computer application or platform to connect drivers of their own vehicles with paying customers needing transportation. Examples of such companies include Uber, Lyft, etc.
vinLabelHelp: A VIN number is generally 17 characters in length and does NOT contain the letters I and O, the numbers 1 or zero are used instead.
antiTheft1LabelHelp:
Alarm

Device that sounds an audible alarm that can be heard at a distance of at least 300 feet for a minimum of three minutes.
antiTheft2LabelHelp:
Manual Disabling Device

Device that disables the vehicle by making the fuel, ignition or starting system inoperative. This device type requires a separate manual step to engage the device.
antiTheft3LabelHelp:
Automatic Disabling Device

Device that disables the vehicle by making the fuel, ignition or starting system inoperative. This device type does not require a separate manual step to engage the device.
antiTheft5LabelHelp:
Lo Jack

Electronic homing device, using a radio frequency network used in conjunction with a participating police agency.
antiTheft6LabelHelp:
Teletrac

Electronic homing device, using a radio frequency network used in conjunction with a participating police agency
antiTheft7LabelHelp:
VIN Etching

Vehicle identification number (VIN) or other unique identifying symbol etched on the vehicle's window (i.e. vehicle's door glass, windshield and rear window).
driverTrainingDateLabelHelp: Date of completion on the certificate received, for successful completion of a driver improvement course sponsored by a DMV certified school.
promotionCodeLabelHelp: Mercury Insurance Group occasionally runs promotional giveaways. For additional promotion information please refer to the relevant terms and conditions.
driverFilingLabelHelp:
SR-22 or SR1P, also called Certificates of Financial Responsibility (CFR) are mandated by the state and provided by your auto insurance company to verify that you have auto insurance liability coverage.

Not everyone needs an SR-22 or SR1P. Usually, one is required by the court or mandated by the state for certain driving-related violations. Examples include: DUI convictions, reckless driving, accidents caused by uninsured drivers. If you need an SR-22 or SR1P, the courts or your state Motor Vehicle Department will notify you.
association2LabelHelp:
Educator Discount

May apply to drivers who are teachers or educational administrators holding a "Clear", "Professional Clear", "Life", or "Preliminary" designation from the State of California Commission on Teacher Credentialing.

Also applies to drivers who are employed full-time as a college or university teacher or professor.
association4LabelHelp:
Engineer Discount

May apply to drivers who have a Bachelor's degree or higher or are licensed as an engineer in one of the following fields of engineering: Aeronautical, Aerospace, Architectural, Chemical, Civil, Electrical, Gas, Mechanical, Nuclear, Petroleum, Structural.
association5LabelHelp:
Government Employees Discount

A discount may apply to drivers who are professional Federal or State of California government employees in an administrative or technical position.
association6LabelHelp:
Alumni Association Discount

A discount may apply to drivers who are current members of an alumni association of a 4 year US accredited college.
association7LabelHelp:
Public Safety Professionals Discount

A discount may apply to drivers who are a member of law enforcement; a firefighter; or a paramedic or EMT.
association8LabelHelp:
Scientist Discount

A discount may apply to drivers who have a Bachelor's degree or higher in one of the following fields:

Biochemistry, Biology, Chemistry, Computer Science, Geology, Geophysics, Information Systems, Mathematics, Meteorology, Physics, Planetary Systems.
matureOrDefensiveDriverLabelHelp:
A discount may apply to principal drivers over the age of 55. To qualify the driver must:

  1. Have received a driver improvement course certificate from a DMV certified school, and
  2. Had no at fault accidents or traffic convictions since completing the course.
goodStudentNoLabelHelp:
A discount may apply to your policy if the driver attends a public or parochial school or college and meets the following criteria:

  1. Is single, and
  2. Has less than 8 years of driving experience, and
  3. Is enrolled as a full time student (minimum of 12 units for undergraduate and 8 units for graduate), and
  4. Had a "B" or better grade point average while a full time student in the previous semester
distantStudentDiscountLabelHelp: A discount may apply if a student has less than eight years of license experience and resides more than 100 miles from the named insured's home without a vehicle.
violationTypeLabelHelp:
Please note that on December 11, 2011, the California Department of Insurance changed how a chargeable accident is defined.

#more Chargeable accidents that occurred before December 11, 2011 #more

#more Chargeable accidents that occurred on or after December 11, 2011 #more
violationTypeLabelHelpMore1:
A chargeable accident that occurred before December 11, 2011 is:

  1. Any accident involving only one vehicle, or
  2. Any accident in which the driver was deemed to be 51% or more at fault and:
    1. The property damage to any one person exceeded $750, or
    2. The accident resulted in bodily injury or death
violationTypeLabelHelpMore2:
A chargeable accident that occurred on or after December 11, 2011 is:

  1. Any accident involving only one vehicle, or
  2. Any accident in which the driver was deemed to be 51% or more at fault and:
    1. The total loss or damage caused by the accident exceeded $1,000, or
    2. The accident resulted in bodily injury or death
salvageAndModificationsHelp: Modified or Customized Vehicle: A vehicle that has been upgraded with aftermarket parts and/or components.
FraudFeeLabelHelp:
State Fee

A state required fraud fee assessed per vehicle for a 6 month policy.
PolicyFeeLabelHelp:
Policy Fee

A non-reimbursable fee required by Mercury Insurance Group.
FilingFeeLabelHelp:
Driver Filing Fee

A fee required for filing proof of financial responsibility with the state.
InstallmentFeeLabelHelp:
Installment Fees

Fees associated with paying your premium in installments.
PALiabilityCov_MIGHelpHelp: Bodily Injury and Property Damage cover damages if you injure someone or their property in an auto accident. For example $50,000/$100,000/$50,000 means you have coverage of $50,000 per person up to a maximum of $100,000 per accident if you injure someone, and $50,000 to cover damage of their property.
PAMedPayCov_MIGHelpHelp:
Medical provides coverage for reasonable medical expenses and/or funeral expenses made necessary due to an accident.
#more Learn more #more
PAMedPayCov_MIGHelpHelpMore1: Medical coverage pays reasonable medical and/or funeral expenses, made necessary due to an accident, for you and other persons occupying your auto. The coverage is provided regardless of fault. This coverage may be excess to other coverage you already own, and is subject to reimbursement under certain conditions specified in detail in the policy.
PAUMBICovCA_MIGHelpHelp:
If you're in an automobile accident with another driver who has caused injury and does not have enough liabililty insurance (Bodily Injury Coverage), uninsured motorist covers the damages that you experience from the accident.
#more Learn more #more
PAUMBICovCA_MIGHelpHelpMore1: Uninsured Motorist Bodily Injury (UMBI) provides coverage if you or other passengers in your vehicle are injured as a result of an accident with an uninsured or underinsured at-fault driver.
PAComprehensiveCov_MIGHelpHelp: Comprehensive coverage pays to repair damages to your vehicle that are not caused by a collision, such as theft, fire, vandalism and hail. Payment for damages are subject to a deductible.
PACollisionCov_MIGHelpHelp: If you're in an auto accident, regardless of who is at fault, collision insurance provides protection to replace or repair your vehicle. Payment for damages is subject to a deductible.
PARentalCov_MIGHelpHelp: Rental car coverage will reimburse you for the rental of a vehicle from a qualified rental agency while an insured vehicle is being repaired due to a covered loss. The coverage is subject to a maximum daily amount for a specified limited period of time.
PARoadSideAssistance_MIGHelpHelp: Mercury's Roadside Assistance provider offers covered services such as towing, locksmith services, battery jump-start, and flat tire change at the place where the vehicle was disabled (limitations and #more exclusions #more may apply).
PARoadSideAssistance_MIGHelpHelpMore1:
1. Routine maintenance of an insured auto;
  2. Labor not related to the disablement;
  3. Installation of products or materials not related to the disablement;
  4. Labor or repair work performed at a service station, garage or repair shop;
  5. Towing from a service station, garage or repair shop;
  6. Tire repair;
  7. Towing from entrapment in snow, mud, water or sand, more than 100 feet from a public road or highway;
  8. Disablement that occurs on road not regularly maintained, or on sand beaches, open fields, or areas designated as impassable due to construction, weather or earth movement;
  9. Towing related to impoundment, abandonment, illegal parking or other violations of law;
  10. Storage charges;
  11. Mounting or removing snow tires or chains; or
  12. Assistance with jacks, levelers or awnings on a motor home.
PACDWCov_MIGHelpHelp: Collision Deductible Waiver (CDW) waives your Collision deductible if your covered vehicle sustains an accident where the other driver was at fault and does not have insurance. Your CDW amount must match the Collision deductible. This coverage is not available if Uninsured Motorist Property Damage is selected.
PAUMPDCov_MIGHelpHelp:
If you're in an automobile accident with another driver who has caused damage to your vehicle and does not have enough insurance, uninsured motorist property damage (UMPD) covers the damages that you experience from the accident.
#more Learn more #more
PAUMPDCov_MIGHelpHelpMore1: Uninsured Motorist Property Damage (UMPD) provides coverage if you sustain vehicle damage caused by being in an automobile accident with an uninsured or underinsured motorist who is legally liable for the accident.
isSalvagedVehicleLabelHelp: A wrecked or damaged vehicle that has been previously deemed a total loss.
tnTransportationLabelHelp: Transportation Network: Used in connection with any "transportation network" company using an internet-enabled computer application or platform to connect drivers of their own vehicles with paying customers needing transportation. Examples of such companies include Uber, Lyft, etc.
verifyMileageLabelHelp: With Mercury's RealDrive Mileage Program, the less miles you drive, the more you save! By enrolling your vehicle(s) and upon qualification, you will receive a discount. By simply providing odometer reading(s) at each renewal, you continue to qualify for a discount.
tnDriverLabelHelp: Transportation Network: Used in connection with any "transportation network" company using an internet-enabled computer application or platform to connect drivers of their own vehicles with paying customers needing transportation. Examples of such companies include Uber, Lyft, etc.
IntervenorFeeLabelHelp:
Intervenor Fee

Recoupment fee for regulatory intervenor costs.
odometerLabelHelp: The odometer is usually found in your vehicle's dashboard and should not be confused with the trip mileage counter which is often adjacent to the odometer. This information may be used to measure the miles driven per year in this vehicle.
